𓋨 𓋧 𒃶 treasurer seal-bearer

𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏 ka4-an-za Kanzel, Kasse (treasury) *kaznь. Kanzel (punishment) < *kʷeḱ- “to see” kuck!
𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏 ka4-an-za-ba-ra /kanzabara/) Achaemenid Elamite chanselor, treasurer
𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏 ka4-an-za-ba-ra < 𒃶𒍝𒁀𒊒 (gan-za-ba-ru /ganzabaru/) (Late Babylonian) Akkadian: treasurer
𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏 ka4-an-za-ba-ra казначе́й kaznačéj
𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏 ka4-an-za-ba-ra ⇔ казначы qaznaçı ხაზინადარი xazinadari خەزىنىچى xezinichi treasurer
𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏 ka4-an-za-ba-ra >> גִּזְבָּר gizbar treasurer <> 𒄃 gil ≈ клад klad ganj 𒃶𒍝𒁀𒊒 gan-za-ba-ru ܓܙܒܪܐ gēzaḇrā գանձապահ ganjapah treasurer

ხაზინადარი xazinadari خزانه دار xazâne-dâr secondary or original?

i 4' 𒀸 𒁄𒎌 𒅀 𒃶𒉣 𒃮𒁺 𒀸 𒈬𒀭𒈾𒎌𒅀 𒆪𒌝𒈬𒊒 𒃶 𒅅𒈝
i 4' ina BALA.MEŠ-ia ḪÉ.NUN ṭuḫ-du ina MU.AN.NA.MEŠ-ia ku-um-mu-ru ḪÉ.GÁL-lum
i 4' in Bāl'es yo conon total; in my.anno's yo cummula con 𒃲 gallum i 4' During my reign, there was plenitude (and) abundance; during my years, bountiful produce was accumulated.

DEMON ⋍ Monster : Lamashtu

𒀭𒁕𒃶 Dagon (Phoenician: 𐤃𐤂𐤍 Dāgūn; Hebrew: דָּגוֹן, Dāgōn) ancient Mesopotamian and ancient Canaanite deity.
𒀭𒁕𒃶 Dagan worshipped as a fertility god in Ebla, Assyria, Ugarit, and among the Amorites.
𒀭𒁕𒃶 Dagan grain / agricultural god, Zeus Arotrios ἄροτρον, 'plow', "grain" siton vs 𓃩 𒅎
𒀭𒁕𒃶 Dagan mermaid dag "fish" (as in Hebrew: דג) originally a weather-god (*dgn 'to be cloudy') dag vs 𓃩 𒅎

𒀭𒁕𒃶 Dagan ⇔ 𒅎 Tarḫunnas Anatolian storm god?

𒀭𒁕𒃶 Dagan dag vs Marduk 𒀭𒀫𒌓 ?

  1. month 𒌚 𒃶 Kislimu Nergal 𒀭𒄊𒀕𒃲 Pabilsag (Sagittarius) - 𒀯𒉺𒉋𒊕 Kislev כִּסְלֵו Kānūn al-Awwal Nov/Dec

At Ebla (Tell Mardikh), from at least 2300 BC, Dagan was the head of the city pantheon comprising some 200 deities
One entire quarter of Ebla and one of its gates were named after Dagan.
Dagan is called ti-lu ma-tim, "dew of the land" and Be-ka-na-na, possibly "Lord of Canaan".

Dagan 𒀭𒁕𒃶 Deo Grain,
Dagan 𒀭𒁕𒃶 wife: Grain goddess Shala / Ishara ⋍ Ishtar
Dagan 𒀭𒁕𒃶 lives in E-Mul (house of stars)

𒃶 garābu [GAN], “mange”, Arabic جَرَب (jarab), Hebrew גָּרָב (gārāḇ). ܓܪܒܐ garəḇā
1. (medicine) leprosy; scabies (Krätze)
2. mouldiness
